data.title: General Hospital Adds Ellie Darcy-Alden and Elise Robertson to the Cast as Part of Carly and Felicia’s Overseas Adventure
data.meta_description: On Thursday’s January 11th episode of General Hospital, Carly (Laura Wright) and Felicia (Kristina Wagner) head overseas to Amsterdam following Bobbie’s memorial service. As previewed, look for an unexpected guest to arrive at the funeral for Bobbie that sends Carly and Felicia off to Europe to settle some unfinished business of the beloved nurse.  Before her […]
data.text:
By

On Thursday’s January 11th episode of General Hospital, Carly (Laura Wright) and Felicia (Kristina Wagner) head overseas to Amsterdam following Bobbie’s memorial service.

As previewed, look for an unexpected guest to arrive at the funeral for Bobbie that sends Carly and Felicia off to Europe to settle some unfinished business of the beloved nurse. Before her death, Bobbie had gone to Amsterdam to help settle her “late” brother Luke’s (Tony Geary) affairs.

Now, two new casting items from Soap Opera Digest look to be short term roles in the Amsterdam leg of the storyline. First, Ellie Darcy-Alden will be making her debut as Cornelia. If Darcy-Alden looks familiar, she played Harry Potter’s mom at a younger age, Lily Evans, in the 2011 film Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2.

In addition, GH also cast Elise Robertson in the role of Famke. Robertson is a veteran actress having appeared in many primetime episodic dramas including: Six Feet Under, Grey’s Anatomy, True Blood, 90210, The Mentalist and Good Trouble to name but a few.

So, just how will Cornelia and Famke figure into the adventure of Carly and Felicia, and where it leads them? Stay tuned. It all remains to be seen.

Looking forward to seeing what drama is in store for Carly and Felicia following Bobbie’s memorial? Comment below.

Johnny Wactor’s Mom Speaks Out On His Murder: Three Months After His Death No Arrests Have Been Made, But Notes Progress in the Case

GENERAL HOSPITAL: Jack Brennan Stays Put In Port Charles: Are You Down for Him Romancing Carly?

General Hospital

Johnny Wactor’s Mom Speaks Out On His Murder: Three Months After His Death No Arrests Have Been Made, But Notes Progress in the Case

By

It is hard to fathom that beloved General Hospital alum, Johnny Wactor’s (ex-Brando Corbin 2020-2022) killers have not been brought to justice, but as of today, Wactor’s family, friends, former co-workers and colleagues, stay vigilante to keep Johnny’s case in the public eye with hopes that soon there will be arrests made in the case.

On Tuesday, for the second time, relatives and friends of Wactor’s gathered outside Los Angeles City Hall to call for people to come forward with information about his death, and to call for stricter laws against crime.

It was back on May 25th in the wee hours of the morning that Wactor was walking with his co-worker towards his parked car near the corner of Hope Street and Pico Boulevard after he finished his bartending shift at the Level 8 bar/restaurant. Wactor, 37, came upon a scene where a crew of seemingly three men were trying to steal the catalytic converter from his vehicle, when one of the masked men shot Wactor in the chest and killed him.

Now, Johnny’s mother, Scarlett Wactor, spoke to Fox 11 News in Los Angeles to give an update on the case and to clarify a key moment leading up to her son’s murder.

Scarlett shared that her son was unable to see what the suspects were doing clearly; due to a streetlight which had been burned out for weeks. She also said that Johnny did not physically confront or try to stop the catalytic converter thieves as had been previously reported. The LAPD reported Wactor was shot without provocation.

There are some breaks in the case, but as Scarlett revealed, the police don’t tell much to her, for fear, she might say something while she is doing media that might hinder the investigation.

Wactor said, “They definitely have a pretty good photo that they’re not releasing, but that they’ve seen this and so this tells me that they’re going in the right direction, that somebody knows something. And we need help from the community to get them arrested and put away and convicted.”

Last week, the LAPD released a few surveillance photos of the suspects. along with images of an allegedly stolen vehicle the suspects are believed to have escaped in. Of note: is that one of the suspects had a tattoo above the left eye and on the right cheek.

Johnny’s mom is also calling for stricter crime laws noting that Los Angeles needs to, “Definitely hire more police. You need more presence, you need more cameras, you don’t need burnt out streetlights. People that work there after midnight, the businesses should be made to provide protected and guarded parking. Definitely change that catalytic converter law. There are things out there that can be done. You need to lower the felony threshold and stop dumbing down the laws.”

As to how she wants her son and the former GH star to be remembered, Scarlett said that Johnny was a good, compassionate person who helped everyone and loved life. Sadly, she concluded, “He had a very big zest for life. And to me, I believe he still had a very big future. And they stole it from him and stole him from us.”

Anyone with information about the suspects is urged to call the LAPD’s Central Station at 213-486-6606. During business hours, LAPD homicide detectives can be reached at 213-996-4143 or 213-996-4173. Tipsters who prefer to remain anonymous can call Crime Stoppers at 800- 222-8477 or visit lacrimestoppers.org.

What are your thoughts that it has been nearly three months and yet no arrests have been made Johnny’s murder? Share your thoughts via the comment section, as we continue to shine a light on his case in the hopes there is ‘Justice for Johnny.’ You can check out Scarlett’s visit to the Fox 11 News below.

General Hospital

Jacqueline Grace Lopez Confirms GH Exit: “This Goodbye Hurts. I Think Because I Didn’t See it Coming.”

By

As previously posted, Jacqueline Grace Lopez made her exit on ABC’s General Hospital when during the Tuesday, August 13th episode, Blaze and Kristina (Kate Mansi) broke up, and then Blaze, for all intent and purposes, broke up with her mother, Natalia (E, who is also her music manager, Natalia (Eva LaRue). That set the stage for the character to leave Port Charles to embark on a world tour performing as the opening act for Miquel Morez (aka Ricky Martin).

On Wednesday, August 14th, Lopez confirmed her exit from the soap opera, taking to Instagram to share her parting words, which included she was surprised that GH wrote Blaze off the canvas.

Jacqueline began, “Not gonna lie, this goodbye hurts. I think because I didn’t see it coming. That and when you spend almost two years with this group, you start to feel like part of the fabric.”

However, she remained so thankful to the GH creatives for the opportunity to be a part of the iconic show. “I’m so grateful to Frank (Valentini, EP, GH) for asking me back. I am grateful to everyone I got to tell stories with, both in front and behind the camera,” she related. “This cast and crew work so hard and have taught me so much. Jobs come and go, but it’s the people you miss. I’m definitely going to miss this bunch.”

Speaking to inclusivity on television, Jacqueline added, “I’ve mentioned that as a brown girl, it’s so hard to see ourselves in media, period. To have writers introduce Latiné story elements because of my character? Even adding a Latiné last name to my character’s name? Getting onscreen family and backstory as a non-contract actor? Being a part of the opening titles?! Turning a 10 episode part into almost two years??? Babyyy, she done did that! Sometimes we have to be the change we don’t see.✨”

Finally, Lopez gave major kudos to the audience at home, saying, “GH FANS!!! My heart is so full. Especially fans that embraced Blaze’s journey as a gay woman and formed community around each other as a result: Y’all got me through some moments. I poured myself into this story because I knew it was going to matter. I just didn’t know how much. You have humbled me, reminding me the need for feeling seen onscreen is absolutely universal to all marginalized communities. I learned that through Allie. Through you. Thank you for sharing your stories, your words of encouragement, and for the generous gifts! Know I carry all of that with me always. I hope I did right by you. That’s all I wanted to do.”

“Ultimately, my joy in this work is to help people feel seen. And for that reason alone, this chapter of Blaze was an absolute gift,” Jacqueline concluded. “It feels so sudden, but I have to trust in timing. Heading out of Port Charles with nothing but gratitude. Thank you General Hospital.”

Jacqueline first played Blaze back in 2022. Following that, she came to the soap a few times before her last run which took her through to this summer.

What do you think about Jacqueline’s parting thoughts? Will you miss her as Blaze? Was her departure part of a show reset from the latest co-head writing regime? Comment below.

General Hospital

GENERAL HOSPITAL: Kristina Breaks Up with Blaze, Then Blaze Fires Natalia as She Leaves Port Charles

By

The same-sex love story of Kristina (Kate Mansi) and Blaze (Jacqueline Grace Lopez) looks to have come to an end on the Tuesday, August 13th episode of General Hospital. With the ‘new attitude’ and grieving Kristina swallowed up in the loss of her baby, she is pushing everyone away.

When Blaze comes to see Kristina in her hospital room, Kristina already knows Blaze got the opportunity of a lifetime to be the opening act for Miquel Morez (Ricky Martin) on his world tour after Natalia (Eva LaRue) came to see her with the news. Blaze insists she won’t leave Kristina while she is recovering in the hospital and because she loves her and wants to be there for her.

Blaze tells Kristina, she is her everything and won’t be pushed away. However, Kristina insists Blaze go for her dream and go on the tour, especially now because Kristina says she is empty and has nothing left to give, because the baby was everything to her. When Blaze tries to reason with her that she can be there to help her though her grief, Kristina says she will end up resenting her because she put her life hold and this opportunity is something Blaze always was born to do.

Kristina tells says Blaze that needs to live her best life. Eventually, after tears are streaming down are face, Blaze says she will go on the tour, but can they, at least, touch base, while she is away. Kristina agrees they can. They share a kiss and Blaze exits, and Kristina breaks down.

Now at the airport with her mother Natalia, Blaze learns that Natalia has to tie up some loose ends before joining her on the European leg of the tour. Blaze gets angry and tells Natalia that she got what she wanted – Kristina dumped her. Now, in turn, Blaze fires Natalia as her manager, before heading out to catch her flight.

If this is Jacqueline Grace Lopez last episode for now, she delivered in these emotional scenes with Kate Mansi and Eva LaRue, and viewers know how on the soaps performers always get some meaty scenes before their exit!

So, are you upset that Kristina and Blaze broke-up? Does this set the tone for a whole new canvas for the character of Kristina moving forward? Do you think Blaze will return? Share your thoughts via the comment section below.
